excerpt: Opened in 2014, this park features lakes, walkways, gardens, playgrounds, eateries, toilets & more.
detail_description: Janeshwar Mishra Park, located in the Gomti Nagar area of Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, is a sprawling urban park that opened in 2014. Spanning 376 acres, it features lakes, gardens, playgrounds, walkways and eateries. The park is designed similar to Hyde Park in London and offers gondola rides on its two large water bodies. Visitors can enjoy jogging and cycling paths as well as a children's play area.
name: Janeshwar Mishra Park
address: Gomti Nagar, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226010, India

excerpt: Grand edifice in sprawling, ornate confines featuring an immense vaulted chamber & dizzying maze.
detail_description: Bara Imambara, also known as Asafi Imambara, is a grand architectural marvel built by Nawab Asaf-ud-Daula in the late 18th century. This historical monument in Lucknow features a large mosque, a labyrinth called Bhul Bhulaiya, and a stepwell with running water. The central hall of Bara Imambara is renowned as the largest vaulted chamber globally and is devoid of any woodwork except for its interior galleries.
name: Bara Imambara
address: VW86+MQ3, Husainabad Trust Rd, Machchhi Bhavan, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226003, India

excerpt: Monumental 1784 city gate & emblem of Lucknow featuring an intricate, Awadhi-style central arch.
detail_description: Rumi Darwaza is a significant historical landmark in Lucknow, standing at 60 feet tall and serving as an emblem of the city. Built in 1784, it showcases intricate Awadhi-style architecture and is associated with the flourishing era of Asaf-ud-Dawlah, known for his patronage of arts and culture. The gateway offers a stunning view and serves as a popular backdrop for nighttime photography due to its brilliant illumination.
name: Rumi Darwaza
address: 17/11 Hussainabad Road, Lajpat Nagar Colony, Lajpat Nagar, Machchhi Bhavan, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226003, India

excerpt: State museum featuring Awadh art & artifacts, plus exhibits covering the area's natural history.
detail_description: The State Museum in Lucknow is a must-visit cultural treasure trove that showcases the rich history and heritage of Uttar Pradesh. Established in 1863, this museum houses an extensive collection of artifacts, manuscripts, and artworks from various periods, providing visitors with a comprehensive insight into the state's cultural legacy. From sculptures and coins to textiles and archaeological findings, the museum meticulously curates its exhibits to illustrate the evolution of Uttar Pradesh's history, culture, and art.
name: State Museum Lucknow
address: RXV3+WRJ, Narhi, Hazratganj, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226001, India

excerpt: 18th century English baroque style house remains featuring towers, walls & an extensive gardens.
detail_description: Dilkusha Kothi is a historical monument in Lucknow that showcases the magnificence of Baroque architecture. Built in the 19th century by Saadat Ali Khan, it is an exact replica of the English country house Seaton Delavel, constructed in 1721. This architectural gem stands out among Lucknow's monuments for its unique style, surrounded by beautifully designed gardens.
name: Dilkusha Kothi
address: RXH7+FV5, Bibiapur Marg, Neil Lines, Cantonment, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226002, India

detail_description: Situated in the heart of the old city, Jama Masjid is renowned as one of India's most stunning mosques. Constructed by Sultan Ahmed Shah and King Mohammad Ali Shah Bahadur, this architectural marvel seamlessly blends Hindu and Muslim design elements. The mosque in Tehseenganj was built to rival Delhi's grand Jama Masjid, showcasing a fusion of Hindu-Jain architecture.
name: JAMA MASJID
address: Maulviganj, Wazirganj, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226018, India

detail_description: Lucknow Zoo, also known as the Nawab Wajid Ali Shah Zoological Garden, is a historic 71.6-acre zoological park situated in the heart of Lucknow, India. Established in 1921 to honor the visit of the Prince of Wales to Lucknow, it stands as one of India's oldest zoos.
name: Lucknow zoo
address: check, Butler Rd, Dalibagh Colony, Butler Colony, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226001, India

excerpt: Vast, imposing stone memorial, with paved pathways, columns & statues, to renowned social reformers.
detail_description: Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Memorial, also known as Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar Samajik Parivartan Prateek Sthal, is a vast and imposing stone memorial located in Gomti Nagar, Lucknow. Spanning across 107 acres, the park is dedicated to renowned social reformers such as Dr.
name: Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Memorial
address: Vipul Khand 2, Vipul Khand 3, Vipin Khand, Gomti Nagar, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226010, India

excerpt: Established in 1921, this zoo houses exotic animal exhibits, a miniature train & food stalls.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Lucknow, the Nawab Wajid Ali Shah Zoological Garden, established in 1921, is a must-visit for animal lovers and history buffs alike. Spanning an impressive 71.9 acres, this historic zoo was created to honor Prince Edward VIII's visit and showcases over nine hundred species of animals, birds, and reptiles. Among its fascinating inhabitants are majestic white tigers, playful hippopotamuses, and rare Rhesus monkeys.
name: Nawab Wajid Ali Shah Zoological Garden
address: near Civil Hospital, Narhi, Hazratganj, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226001, India

excerpt: Colonial-era tower with a mechanical clock, set in a park popular for evening gatherings.
detail_description: The Clock Tower Hussainabad in Lucknow is a magnificent colonial-era structure that was built in 1881. Designed by Richard Roskell Bayne, it stands at a towering height of 67 meters, making it the tallest clock tower in India. The architecture reflects Victorian and Gothic styles, adorned with intricate designs and Mughal influences that showcase the city's rich heritage.
name: Clock Tower Hussainabad Lucknow
address: Hussainabad Rd, near chota imambara, Husainabad, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226003, India

excerpt: Historical site featuring the ruins of a refuge for British citizens during the Revolt of 1857.
detail_description: The Residency in Lucknow is a captivating historical site that offers a glimpse into the past, particularly during the tumultuous times of the Revolt of 1857. Nestled amidst beautifully terraced lawns and gardens, this remarkable complex was originally constructed as living quarters for British officials under Nawab Saadat Ali Khan between 1780 and 1800. Overlooking the serene River Gomti, it served as a refuge for British citizens during one of India's most significant uprisings.
name: The Residency, Lucknow
address: VW6G+7P3, Mahatma Gandhi Marg, Deep Manak Nagar, Kaiser Bagh, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226001, India

detail_description: Hazratganj Market, located in the heart of Lucknow, is a historic area with deep roots dating back to 1810. Originally a route for British vehicles and wagons, it has evolved into a vibrant commercial hub offering a mix of traditional and modern retail experiences. The market boasts numerous shops, restaurants, and entertainment venues that attract both locals and tourists.
name: Hazratganj
address: 40/55, Deputy Raghubar Dayal Ln, Sadullah Nagar, Narahi Bazar, Narhi, Hazratganj, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226001, India

excerpt: Saturn-shaped planetarium with a high-tech projection system & sound, and multiple shows daily.
detail_description: Indira Gandhi Planetarium, also known as Taramandal or Nakshatra Shala, is a must-visit in Lucknow for science enthusiasts and anyone curious about the world of stars and astrology. The planetarium's unique Saturn-shaped building with five rings surrounded by water makes it stand out. It features a high-tech projection system, digital sound, air conditioning, and accessibility for all visitors.
name: Indira Gandhi Planetarium
address: Vigyan Bhavan, 9, Nabiullah Rd, Surajkund park, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226018, India

detail_description: La Martiniere College, located in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, is a prestigious educational institution with a unique blend of Gothic and Indian architectural styles. The college's magnificent buildings and expansive gardens make it a must-see historical site in Lucknow. Constantia House, part of La Martiniere College, showcases the city's colonial heritage through its neoclassical design.
name: La Martiniere College
address: La Martiniere Rd, Martin Purva, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226001, India

detail_description: The Maqbara (Tomb) of Saadat Ali Khan is a well-preserved mausoleum located in the Qaiser Bagh locality of Lucknow. It is the final resting place of Nawab Saadat Ali Khan, the fifth nawab wazir of Oudh.
name: Maqbara (Tomb) of Saadat Ali Khan
address: Sadat Ali Khan Tomb, Kaiser Bagh, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226001, India

excerpt: Urban green space with manicured lawns, paddle boats on narrow waterways & children's play areas.
detail_description: Gautam Buddha Park, located in Hasanganj in Lucknow, is a serene urban green space offering manicured lawns, paddle boats on narrow waterways, and children's play areas. It's an ideal spot for families to spend a memorable weekend surrounded by lush greenery and blooming flowers. The park features swings, slides, and electric powered rides for kids as well as paddle boating at a nominal price.
name: Gautam Buddha Park
address: Mahatma Gandhi Marg, Iradat Nagar, Hasanganj, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226003, India

excerpt: Iconic 1800s watchtower with a stout octagonal base, arched windows & Islamic design details.
detail_description: Satkhanda is an iconic watchtower located in Lucknow, dating back to the 1800s. It was intended to be a seven-story structure but remains incomplete at four stories due to the untimely demise of King Mohammed Ali Shah, who initiated its construction. The red-brick tower features Islamic design details and bears resemblance to the Leaning Tower of Pisa. Despite being unfinished, it stands as a marvelous piece of architecture and is a popular attraction for visitors in Lucknow.
name: Satkhanda
address: Husainabad Trust Rd, Husainabad, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226003, India

detail_description: The Musical Fountain at the Picture Gallery pond, Shahi Talab, is a popular attraction in Lucknow. The multi-colored fountains move to the tunes of various music, creating a serene and enchanting atmosphere as evening falls. This spectacle can be enjoyed by visitors of all ages, offering a tranquil experience for adults while also captivating the interest of children and teenagers. The fountain show takes place in the evenings when the lighting effects enhance its beauty.
name: Musical Fountain
address: VX38+6JF, Jiamau, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226001, India

detail_description: Moti Mahal, situated in the bustling area of Hazratganj, stands out as a renowned dining establishment in Lucknow. This eatery is celebrated for its delectable array of desserts, including traditional favorites like laddus and jalebis.
name: Moti mahal
address: 2/639, Rashmi Khand, Sharda Nagar, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226012, India

detail_description: St. Joseph Cathedral Church, also known as Hazratganj Church, is a historic and serene place located in the bustling area of Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh. Established in 1860 by an Irish priest, it stands as one of the oldest cathedrals in the state. The architecture of this church sets it apart from others in India, making it a must-visit for its unique design and soul-soothing ambiance.
name: St. Joseph Cathedral Church
address: VW2V+542, Shahnajaf Rd, Hazratganj, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh 226001, India
